message.content:
cs.CL, cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR 

This paper discusses the use of text analysis techniques to detect deception and obfuscation in written communication, which falls under the sub-categories of computational linguistics (cs.CL), cryptography and security (cs.CR), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), machine learning (cs.LG), and information retrieval (cs.IR). The paper specifically focuses on the limitations of existing linguistic features for detecting deception and proposes the use of textual similarity measures instead, which is a common topic in computational linguistics and information retrieval. The discussion of author identification and style obfuscation also relates to cryptography and security, as well as machine learning and artificial intelligence techniques for anonymization and privacy preservation.
